instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.PP1V8_CAM: What is PP1V8_CAM? PP1V8_CAM is a 1.8v power rail for powering the webcam.

threads.title: water damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A running super slow
threads.message: Hello everyone, I got a Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) that was previously water damaged. Its running super slow. There isn't any corrosion on the logic board.  After running the ASD I noticed there was a problem with my camera sensor. I troubleshooted this circuit and found a short on <SIGNAL>CAM_SENSOR_WAKE</SIGNAL>. I have tried to remove most of the components in this line but i can't releive the short. Am I looking at the wrong place? I traced this line down to <SIGNAL>PP1V8_CAM</SIGNAL> and this line seems to be fine. If anyone can help out ; it will be greatly appreciated. Cheers!

threads.title: water damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A running super slow
water damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A running super slow
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 20059"]camera disconnected?? corrosion under J4002??
[/QUOTE]

Thanks for your input bro. the camera is disconnected. It needs to be replaced due to the corrosion. I have desolder J4002 to ensure there wasn't any corrosion underneath causing this problem but still the same thing. Duke can you enlighten me?

threads.title: water damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A running super slow
threads.message:
Cam sensor wake is supposed to be tied to GND, did you bother to look at the schematic and trace out the circuit?

Run ASD to see which sensor is fucked.
